Text:
Why would you download HD anime? Is it more like real life? No. Does it look a lot better? No.
I just don't get it.
It's been a while since such awesome comments occured. Oh, the good old times.

BTW, this is NOT "Code Geass - Lelouch of the Rebellion R2" This is the first series named "Code Geass - Lelouch of the Rebellion" (the R2 should be removed from heading). Torrent is mislabeled. Season two is called Code Geass - Lelouch of the Rebellion R2
Correction. This IS the R2 version. My mistake. Heading is correct. Sorry thanks [D]

@ puuba:

Its not about it being more like real life.

It's about when I want to watch an anime, I'd love for the picure quality on my 62" HDTV to not look like my 3-year old daughter's crayon pictures after a rabid panda has eaten them all, and shit them back out, and animated them using a flick-book, and then passed them through every filter of the earliest version of photoshop.

It might just be me... But I like a clear and crisp pic. :)

Many thanks to the uploader, I think this is one of the only code Geass downloads I've had where some prick hasn't dubbed his own voice into the intro songs. :D

Am I the only one noticing that this is really a big size per file for 720p. It is anime and requires less size than IRL movies/series. I've downloaded Code Geass R1 in 1080p in the same size as this. I know what the "geeks" are thinking, it is raw 720p hd. But I would answer that back with; If you are a good ripper, you could easily rip it to 250mb per file and not loose anything in quality, as the eye can see.
Naruto & Bleach and all those popular animes are ripped as 250mb per episode (720p)
broken videos. all i was able to watch was half of the opening theme before the video cut out.

more seeders!!!!
just finished R1 and i want to see this!!!!
@Puuba why would you look at Jpgs in 100% quality? It does look a lot better. Sharper, crisper lines, no artifacts from crappy compression. Audio is often less compressed.
